bio:
Beilei Gu is a Language Lecturer at NYU Shanghai. She holds a master’s degree from New York University Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development.

After Graduation, She taught at Baruch College of City University of New York, Department of Modern language and Comparative literature and China Institute in up eastside of New York City. She taught Elementary and intermediate Chinese to heritage and non-heritage students. In 2010, she joined Northwestern University Weinberg college of Arts and Sciences, Department of East Asian and Africa Language teaching Intermediate Chinese.

Research Interests

  • Chinese Literature
  • Chinese music, drama, film study
  • Shanghai Dialect

Courses Taught

  • Advanced Chinese II

Education

  • MA, Foreign Language Education-Teaching Chinese as Second Language
    New York University, 2008
  • BS, Leadership and Management Study
    New York University, 2006
